meaning_str.bing:
n. 观众；读者；接见；晋见
网络. 听众；受众；阅听人

观众；听众；读者；接见；进见；觐见；会见；拜见；谒见；倾听；关注者；支持者；爱好者；拥护者；申诉的机会

1.en: Today, he continues to make at least one film a year and remains the world's number-one action star, never ceasing to amaze his audience!
1.cn: 今天，他继续拍一年至少一部电影，仍然是世界上的第一动作明星永远不会停止惊奇他的观众！

2.en: A superb teacher, with a fine grasp of the appropriate metaphor, and tailoring his teachings to the audience at hand.
2.cn: 一位庄严的老师，善于使用适当的隐喻，对即将到来的听众随机说法。

3.en: He is able to give you what you want to hear and what he wanted to give the audience in terms of knowledge.
3.cn: 他是能够给你你想要什么听到什么，他想给观众在知识方面。

0.en: Can you tell the audience your name? Suzy Sheep.
0.cn: 告诉观众你的名字吧？我叫小羊苏西。

1.en: Can you tell the audience your name? Suzy Sheep.
1.cn: 告诉观众你的名字吧？我叫小羊苏西。

2.en: The audience are in their seats, Mr. Moon. Great!
2.cn: 观众们已经坐好了，伯乐先生。很好！

3.en: Step 3: Pander to your audience. The best public speakers know how to work around.
3.cn: 第三：迎合你的观众优秀的演说家知道要如何迎合观众。

4.en: Uh, first time for me, as well as for you and the audience.
4.cn: 对我来说第一次，对你和观众来说也是第一次。

5.en: Yeah, when we're in the audience, he doesn't talk to us but he does wave.
5.cn: 我们坐在观众席，他是没说话，但有跟我们招手。

6.en: When I'm in a play and you're in the audience, I don't talk to you, right?
6.cn: 我演舞台剧，你坐观众席，我也不会跟你说话，是吧？

7.en: If there's a silence then turned that into a joke. Stay natural, self-facing and the audience will be on your side. Let's recap.
7.cn: 如果观众不笑，就当作自我解嘲。保持自然，忠实呈现自我这样观众就会喜欢你了。再复习一遍！

8.en: Unless there's anybody in the audience that would like to volunteer to stop eating? None, not one.
8.cn: 除非观众中有人决定绝食？不，没人会。

9.en: A huge audience the parade draws attracts performers from all over the world.
9.cn: 来看游行的观众非常之多，这也吸引了来自世界各地的表演者。

10.en: Oh my gosh! How many people are in the audience? A hundred? A thousand ? Don't count.
10.cn: 我的天呀！有多少观众啊？一百位？ 一千位？别数了！

11.en: That's what he wants. He wants to beat us. He wants to be seen doing it. He wants an audience.
11.cn: 就得把我们都击败，想要打败我们还想要别人来见证这一刻，他想要观众。

12.en: Something that will start to convince the audience that you're taking control and finally that knockout all land a blow a statement that's a memorable convincing and sums up your speeches position.
12.cn: 用可以说服观众的事情，让你能掌握主导权最后，做个强而有力的总结让观众留下深刻的印象且完全被你说服。

13.en: I believe there was another thing you wanted to tell them, DW? You know what else the audience likes? Authenticity!
13.cn: 我觉得你还没说完，是吧？你们知道观众还喜欢什么吗？真实性。

14.en: Sometimes the two-dimensional effect does not turn out to be facing to the audience, because the shell is spinning in very very high speed.
14.cn: 有时二维效果最后并没有面对观众，因为烟花弹旋转速度很快。

15.en: First, start with some fancy footwork. A fact or an anecdote that will hook the audience and get them to pay attention to you.
15.cn: 第一：华丽的起头。用一个事实或轶事来吸引观众让他们聚焦在你的演说。

16.en: You said, You cannot lie on stage. The audience will always know what is inside your heart. I think I understand now.
16.cn: 你说“在舞台上不能骗人”，“观众一定知道你内心的想法”，我想我现在懂了。

17.en: In your wellcast worksheet, write down the major points that you want to get across to the audience get the idea out of your head onto the paper.
17.cn: 在你的学习单上写下你最想向观众传达的事，把你的点子写在纸上。

18.en: Now, you only get one shot to blow that audience away, so choose carefully from the list of songs I've selected for each of you.
18.cn: 你们只有一次机会征服台下的观众，所以你们要慎重选择我为你们列的曲目。

19.en: You're a performer. You kneel down on the wire. You unhook from side, clip it on the other. The audience will think you are saluting.
19.cn: 你是表演者，在钢索上跪下来，解开侧边钩子，夹在另一边，观众会以为你在敬礼。
